channel.title: Radial walk help
channel.description:
I'm kinda(very confused). I read a tutorial on radial walk at SRL, but I still cannot understand one part of the code. Eg.
[code] procedure Dothis; begin if RadialWalk(FindColor, 332, 375, 53, 0, 0) then begin if FindSymbolT(x, y, 'symbol') then begin Mouse(x, y + 15, 1, 1, true); // this part Flag; end else Dothisthing; end; end;[/code]
I didn't try it out because my runescape for some stupid reason doesn't update. Anyway, I don't understand, why is there a [code] + 15[/code] Could anyone tell me what the +15means and how it is useful? Is it something to do with the way the character walks?

item.title: Radial walk help
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Okay, thanks a lot for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Radial walk help
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yep, cause In computer Terms 0, 0 in X, Y is the Top left corner, X increases rightwards, Y increases Downwards

Read full topic

item.title: Radial walk help
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Thanks, but I got one more question
If positive 15 means that they would click underneath then does negative 15 mean they will click above?

Read full topic

item.title: Radial walk help
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

So they will click underneath the Y coordinates the Symbol was found at

Read full topic
